page.title: 15MERSHAM HATCH ESTATE
page.content: The Mersham Hatch Estate has belonged to the Brabourne Family for 500 years It once consisted of 16,188 ha.but now it is only 1,618 ha.The estate extends from the chalk escarpment of the North Downs into gault clay and greensand. Gault is the best farmland and the greensand is wooded. The estate is a combined dairy and ara- ble farm,with 1052 ha. under crops and grass;243 ha.woods;162 ha.amenity land. A further 162 ha.are let.40 farmhouses are let to London business and profess- al families as weekend homes.One is Quarrington.Some of the cottages are old dating back to 1600;Naccolt Farm- house was built with bricks from the fire of London. Driving round this farm in June the fields look varying shades of green with the different crops slowly ripen- ing.There is little activity anywhere.
